Description: Fragment of round handle from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay fine purplish buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Name Heraios. cf. Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) 174. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 32, 17 or 206, 67
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1280)
